clean_content:
Definition / general

* Rare, benign pathologic process that is the oral counterpart of cutaneous focal mucinosis or cutaneous myxoid cyst ([Int J Oral Maxillofac Surg 1990;19:337](2128309))

Essential features

* Clinically manifests as a nodular mass with a predilection for gingiva and hard palatal mucosa ([J Cutan Pathol 2021;48:24](33410541))* Oral focal mucinosis has a predilection for women in the fourth or fifth decade of life ([J Cutan Pathol 2021;48:24](33410541))* Cause of oral focal mucinosis is unknown but it is thought to result from the overproduction of hyaluronic acid by mucosal fibroblasts ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2017;21:273](28932039))* Histologically, the lesion presents as a submucosal lesion with an area of nonencapsulated mucinous / myxoid connective tissue containing widely separated collagen fibers and scattered ovoid, spindled or stellate fibroblasts

Terminology

* Oral focal mucinosis was first described in 1974 by Tomich, who suggested that these lesions are the oral counterpart of cutaneous focal mucinosis or cutaneous myxoid cyst ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;38:714](4140487))

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [K13.79](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K13-/K13.79) - other lesions of oral mucosa* ICD-11: [DA01.Y](https://icd.who.int/browse/2024-01/mms/en#569611257%2Fother) - other specified disorders of oral mucosa

Epidemiology

* Predominantly affects women and commonly occurs in the fourth or fifth decade of life ([J Cutan Pathol 2021;48:24](33410541))

Sites

* Gingiva and hard palatal mucosa are the most affected sites (58.2% and 15.3%, respectively) ([J Cutan Pathol 2021;48:24](33410541))

Pathophysiology

* Oral focal mucinosis is thought to result from the overproduction of hyaluronic acid by oral mucosal fibroblasts
  + Excessive amounts of hyaluronic acid cause myxoid degeneration of the connective tissue ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2017;21:273](28932039))

Etiology

* Cause of oral focal mucinosis is unknown

Clinical features

* Usually presents as a nonspecific, asymptomatic, sessile or pedunculated, nodular mass with a fibrous appearance (unless secondarily infected)

Diagnosis

* Biopsy* Nodular mass that may be detected as an incidental finding

Prognostic factors

* Prognosis excellent; rare recurrence

Case reports

* 13 year old girl with hyperplastic gingiva between the left mandibular first and second molar ([BMJ Case Rep 2019;12:e232671](31852693))* 15 year old girl with a swelling posterior to the left mandibular second molar that is slowly enlarging ([J Exp Ther Oncol 2019;13:49](30658027))* 17 year old girl with pedunculated, exophytic nodule of the right anterior palatal gingiva ([Clin Case Rep 2022;10:e6594](36415716))* 41 year old woman with 8 month history of growing palatal mass ([Autops Case Rep 2018;8:e2018044](30775321))

Treatment

* Surgical excision

Clinical images

Contributed by Richard J. Vargo, D.M.D., M.B.A.  

[![Pedunculated gingival mass](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisvargo01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisvargo01.jpg)

Pedunculated gingival mass

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Localized, nonencapsulated area of mucinous / myxoid connective tissue surrounded by normal, fibrocollagenous tissue
  + Typically presents beneath the surface epithelium and often compresses rete ridges+ Mucinous / myxoid areas exhibit scant capillaries, particularly compared to surrounding dense connective tissue
      - Mucinous / myxoid zones are not especially inflamed but a perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate is frequently seen within surrounding connective tissue* Fibroblasts within mucinous / myxoid regions can have an ovoid, spindled or stellate morphology
    + Cells may demonstrate fine fibrillar processes* No reticulin is evident within the lesion and Alcian blue (pH 2.5) routine stain indicates that the mucinous / myxoid component is hyaluronic acid ([Pathology 2003;35:393](14555382))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Joshua Seth Goldfaden, D.D.S.  

[![Compressed rete ridges](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden01.jpg)

Compressed rete ridges

[![Stellate fibroblasts](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden02.jpg)

Stellate fibroblasts

[![Perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden03new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden03new.jpg)

Perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate

[![Ovoid fibroblasts](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden04new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden04new.jpg)

Ovoid fibroblasts

[![Spindled fibroblasts](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden05new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden05new.jpg)

Spindled fibroblasts

  

[![Fibroblastic fibrillar processes](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden06.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden06.jpg)

Fibroblastic fibrillar processes

[![Nonencapsulated, mucinous / myxoid stroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden07.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden07.jpg)

Nonencapsulated, mucinous / myxoid stroma

[![Stromal basophilic hue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden09new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden09new.jpg)

Stromal basophilic hue

[![Alcian blue (pH 2.5) positive material](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden08.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityfocalmucinosisgoldfaden08.jpg)

Alcian blue (pH 2.5) positive material

Positive stains

* [Alcian blue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsalcianblue.html) (pH 2.5) exhibits strong, diffuse positivity in mucinous / myxoid stromal regions ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2018;126:e42](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.oooo.2018.02.035))

Negative stains

* Spindle cells are negative for [PAS](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainspas.html), [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html), [vimentin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsvimentin.html) and [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html) ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2018;126:e42](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.oooo.2018.02.035))

Sample pathology report

* Anterior hard palatal mucosa, left, excisional biopsy:
  + Oral focal mucinosis

Differential diagnosis

* [Myxoid neurofibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueneurofibroma.html):
  + May be hypocellular with myxoid changes+ Consists of Schwann cells, mast cells and fibroblasts; nuclear atypia may be noted+ Stromal spindle cells exhibit [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) positivity* [Superficial angiomyxoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/skintumornonmelanocyticsuperficialangio.html):
    + Myxoid stroma with dispersed collagen fibers+ Numerous blood vessels+ Spindle cells exhibit [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html) positivity* [Intramuscular myxoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuemyxoma.html):
      + Hypocellular stroma with scattered, bland cells that exhibit no mitotic activity; minimal blood vessels and focal histiocytes may be noted+ There may be hypercellular areas or areas with increased vasculature+ Slightly more cellular at periphery with a distinct collagen capsule+ May infiltrate skeletal muscle at periphery; the involved skeletal muscle may be atrophic+ Spindle cells exhibit [CD34](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd34.html) positivity ([Ann Diagn Pathol 2019;43:151409](31726379))* [Odontogenic myxoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillamyxoma.html):
        + Erratically arranged stellate, spindle shaped and round cells in profuse fibrillary myxoid stroma+ Small islands of inactive odontogenic epithelium may be present+ Radiographic findings should be correlated with histopathologic diagnosis* [Mucocele](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitymucocele.html):
          + Pseudocystic cavity filled with extravasated mucin+ Numerous foamy histiocytes in addition to neutrophils and granulation tissue+ Adjacent minor salivary gland lobules may be present+ Mucoceles are only present in anatomic sites with salivary glands (i.e., these lesions cannot be found on attached gingiva)
